alert.note: Alert for Imperial (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued February 15 at 3:38PM PST until February 15 at 5:30PM PST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Northwestern Imperial County in southeastern California... * Until 530 PM PST. * At 336 PM PST, a dust channel was over Bombay Beach, or 15 miles northeast of Salton City, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... CA Route 111 between mile markers 52 and 64. CA Route 86 between mile markers 49 and 62. Locations impacted include... Salton City, Bombay Beach, Winona and Imperial Hot Mineral Springs. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
